body: @KomachiSion Thank you. I will take some time for deeply understanding the component, and then discuss with you.
@limingwei Thank for your contribution, though i approved it,  merge should be done after all the integration pass.

> What is your expected action to using lock in a sharding databases? just lock all of the table?
> 
> Using lock with ShardingSphere is not a good practice, because ShardingSphere on Sharding is for horizontal split. If you want use distribute lock, maybe you can try zookeeper.

I'm integrating Shardingsphere into an old application. The lock is worked in another dependent jar related to db, and it's just a distributed lock for intializing. To keep the jar pure, we don't want to introduce another jar like zookeeper or redis for a distribute lock in the jar at moment.  Keeping the lock and release work on the same database is just ok for us at moment.

@tristaZero @terrymanu  use the latest version , when insert by mybatis, the parameters were still found to be out of ordered.   I think it's the cause of the parameter "time_inst: now()". here is scenario:

 ==>  Preparing: insert into cust_contact_sharding (id,cust_id, unique_id, contact_name, contact_relation, contact_mobile, contact_address, time_inst, time_upd) values (?,?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, **now()** , ?) 
 ==> Parameters: 117001(Long), 4(Long), 84719733d69047eba078e914c49488c7(String), 歉(String), TEST(String), 15907200513(String), 测试地址(String), null

sharding value 84719733d69047eba078e914c49488c7,value after sharding cust_contact_6

      contact_relation, contact_mobile, contact_address,

      ?, ?, ?, 
       now() , ?)

Hi @bxvs888 , can you provide more details, such as  your configuration、SQL、code and so on.

@dongzl 
spring jdbc  postgres 
driver: postgresql-42.2.8.jar
jdbc config:
  datasource:
    driver-class-name: org.postgresql.Driver
    url: jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:3307/CHL_WS_CMD
    username: root
    password: root
    type: com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
    hikari:
      minimum-idle: 5
      maximum-pool-size: 15
      auto-commit: true
      idle-timeout: 30000
      pool-name: ACMHikariCP
      max-lifetime: 1800000
      connection-timeout: 30000
      connection-test-query: SELECT 1

execute SQL : SELECT ID,NAME, dict_code  FROM API_DICT WHERE ID=? OR ID=?  

ShardingSphere  rule config:
bindingTables:
- api_dict
masterSlaveRules:
  DS_01:
    loadBalanceAlgorithmType: ROUND_ROBIN
    masterDataSourceName: DS_00_01
    slaveDataSourceNames:
    - DS_00_02
  DS_02:
    loadBalanceAlgorithmType: ROUND_ROBIN
    masterDataSourceName: DS_01_02
    slaveDataSourceNames:
    - DS_01_01
tables:
  api_dict:
    actualDataNodes: DS_01.api_dict,DS_02.api_dict
    databaseStrategy:
      standard:
        preciseAlgorithmClassName: com.apsaras.shardingsphere.algorithm.HashRangeAlgorithm
        shardingColumn: dict_code

1. If we want to change the version of mysql-connector-java from 5.x to 8.x, we should also update the  HikariCP. Because HikariCP-**java7** at 2.4.11 in Sharding-Proxy now does not compatible with mysql-connector-java 8.x.

2. If we want to upgrade HikariCP, we should also update the Java version from 1.7 to 1.8.

3. Connector/J 8.x also requires Java 1.8
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24643893/66699724-b8b0b880-ed1b-11e9-8263-d6aaa83acc3b.png)

So, to resolve this problem we should firstly answer the question that when we upgrade the Java 1.7 to 1.8?

finally, the xml definition is:

```xml
<rewrite-assertions yaml-rule="xxx.yaml">
    <rewrite-assertion id="xxx" db-type="xxx">
        <input sql="xxx" parameters="x, x" />
        <output sql="xxx" parameters="x, x" />
    </rewrite-assertion>
</rewrite-assertions>
```

Closed because title doesn't make sense.
Distribute solution is not Silver Bullet, please refactor old system towards distribute solution.

All test cases of encrypt are in `incubator-shardingsphere/sharding-core/sharding-core-rewrite/src/test/resources/encrypt`

This case is in `insert.xml` case id is `insert_values_for_parameters`
All test cases are related #1548

> Distribute solution is not Silver Bullet, please refactor old system towards distribute solution.

Firstly, I don't think db lock on the same database is not a distribute solution, although it may not be the best solution in most cases.


Then, let's skip the distribute lock.
The case that database partition is only required for some special tables exists, which means all other tables being in a default or primary database, sql with no tables is the same. `default-data-source-name` is worked for the case on other tables,  if support for no table is added,  the function of `default-data-source-name` can be better.
Do we talk about horizontal sharding?

> Do we talk about horizontal sharding?

I'm sorry for using inappropriatethe case, which made us be involed into distributed lock.
My point is on adding default database support for sql without tables.
Let me describle my case agnin:
I have two db `db1` and `db2`.  `db1` ows table `t1`,`t2`,`t3`, function `f1`,  and  `db2` only onws `t2`. 
Only table  `t2` was in partition, so I want sql related to  `t1` , `t3`, `f1` to be executed on db1, only `t2` be executed on `db1` and `db2` according to it's condition. I use the configuration `spring.shardingsphere.sharding.default-data-source-name`, now sql related to  `t1` or `t3` was executed on `d1` as expected, but `f2`'s execution was in random.

Yes, you are right, the problem is caused by OR.
The OR keyword should not appear in simpleExpr.

Reference #3077.

@terrymanu 
By using the latest version, I still find that the order of the parameters is wrong:
The generating logic for encrypting rewriting sql is to replace the original field with an encrypted fields，then append the original fields to the end of the sql
now，The sql is generated in sqltoken order in the inserted column like this:
[name_encrypt, ident_encrypt, mobile_encrypt, , **mobile, ident, name**, SQLToken(startIndex=269)]
**the order  in insert segment  is mobile、ident、name**
but the parameters are generated from high to low in the treeMap order(descendingMap) of addedIndexAndParameters
the original addedIndexAndParameters is:
** mobile、ident、name**
{17=[13505347525], 18=[600232419893887186], 19=[卓镂格]}
after desc ordered and calculated is：
13505347525, 卓镂格, 600232419893887186]
**mobile、name、ident**

**Original SQL:**
insert into user_info (cust_id, unique_id, name, 
      ident, mobile, password, 
      reg_time, modify_time, reg_source, 
      reg_app_channel, reg_device_info, status, 
      is_mobile_authed, complate_cust_info, time_inst, 
      time_upd, has_checked)
    values (?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?,  ? , 
      ?, ?)
**Rewrited SQL:**
insert into user_info (cust_id, unique_id, name_encrypt, 
      ident_encrypt, mobile_encrypt, password, 
      reg_time, modify_time, reg_source, 
      reg_app_channel, reg_device_info, status, 
      is_mobile_authed, complate_cust_info, time_inst, 
      time_upd, has_checked, **mobile, ident, name**)
  values (?, ?, ?, 
?, ?, ?,
?, ?, ?,
?, ?, ?, 
?, ?, ?, 
?, ?, ?, ?, ?)

**Rewrited Parametes:**
**...mobile，name，ident**
...13505347525, 卓镂格, 600232419893887186]

I guess, this causes the values stored in the database to be disordered!

code:
org.apache.shardingsphere.core.rewrite.parameter.builder.impl.StandardParameterBuilder
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8772975/66743433-74a0ed80-eeac-11e9-8a15-3cf751896651.png)
What is your version and SQL?

Hi @zbj1986 , I read ShardingSphere source code about pagination, I think this problem has already  been fixed, it will be include 4.0.0-RC3 version. You can focus on the RC3‘s release.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5917359/66794587-a6f62d80-ef34-11e9-8b21-8ca0dfca4f7a.png)

when updating, the original value is replaced for the first time, the original value parameter is added to the new parameter list, the index of the encryption field and the original field is changed, and the parameter index of the next encryption field should be obtained from the changed parameters, instead of continuing to get it from the original list of parameters，or using the rules that generate encrypted fields to set the index of the parameters:
currentReplacedIndex = originalParameter's index 
currentAddedIndex = originalParameter's index + current count (1,2,3...for each index)  + 1

Okay!
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
The encrypt feature can support use original column as cipher column if user define the encrypt rule for same name of logic column and cipher column.
Using encrypt method to handle encrypt logic is better than modify original SQL by responsibility separated reason.

ShardingSphere can't resharding automatically for now.
Auto scaling out feature is developing, sharding-scaling will be merged after release 4.0.0-RC3.
Detail see #3077 .

After checking and testing the code, I found that the problem was like this：
The order of the field columns in the configured encryption rules must be consistent with the order in which the code are written in SQL, otherwise the SQL parameters rewite at the time of insertion will be disordered.
**configured encryption rule:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8772975/66805515-d36f7100-ef57-11e9-8181-a14d57973591.png)
**SQL:**:
**input**: the order is  password、 amout
INSERT INTO t_account(account_id, password, amount, status) VALUES (?, ?, ?, 'OK')
1, aaa, 1000
**Actual**:
INSERT INTO t_account(account_id, cipher_password, cipher_amount, status, amount, password) VALUES (?, ?, ?, 'OK', ?, ?)
[1, encrypt_aaa, encrypt_1000, 1000, aaa]
**Expected**:
INSERT INTO t_account(account_id, cipher_password, cipher_amount, status, password, amount) VALUES (?, ?, ?, 'OK', ?, ?)
[1, encrypt_aaa, encrypt_1000, aaa, 1000]

if it is a multiple of that encryption field, the order of the parameter will be more messy. 

When inserted, it is processed in the following order:
org.apache.shardingsphere.core.rewrite.feature.encrypt.parameter.impl.EncryptInsertValueParameterRewriter

> The modification may cause problem.
> Right now we just can recognize 2 model:
> 
>     1. xxx = xxx
> 
>     2. xxx = values(xxx)

> 
> The problem of this issue is AST. AST should make consist of set assignment as `3` children, the right value should in one node and other more expression should in the next level of AST.
> We need to modify g4 file to change the structure of AST.

g4 like this will be ok?
```
assignment
    : columnName EQ_ assignmentRight_

    : VALUES LP_ RP_ | assignmentValue

> That maybe not enough because the expression may `values(xx) + values(xx)`.
> So `VALUES` should be a part of expr

```
assignmentRight_
    : VALUES LP_ assignmentValue RP_ | assignmentValue
    ;

setAssignmentsClause
    : SET assignment (COMMA_ assignment)*
    ;

assignmentValues
    : LP_ assignmentValue (COMMA_ assignmentValue)* RP_

    ;

assignmentValue
    : expr | DEFAULT | blobValue
    ;
```
